definition: to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all

sentences.english: Is it time to move the capital now?
sentences.chinese: 现在到了迁都的时候了吗？

sentences.english: Geographic environment has an importancent effect on the capital moving of Bohai regime.
sentences.chinese: 地理环境对渤海政权迁都产生了重要的作用。

sentences.english: It has been a protrudent phenomenon for the enterprise to move the capital to another place in Chinese economy recently.
sentences.chinese: 企业“迁都”是近年来中国经济一个突出现象。

sentences.english: Datong is the capital of Beiwei Dynasty. And Xiaowendi Emperor move the capital to Luoyang.
sentences.chinese: 大同，是北魏的都城，到孝文帝时才迁都洛阳。

sentences.english: The devastation was so complete, the loss so profound, that Japan considered moving the capital.
sentences.chinese: 如此完整的破坏，损失如此深刻，即日本认为迁都。

definition: to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
the Northern Expedition, the Nationalists' campaign of 1926-1928 under Chiang Kai-shek, against the rule of local warlords
to determine the position of the capital/to found a capital
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
provisional capital of a country (e.g. in time of war)/secondary capital/alternative capital
to dispatch an army/to send troops
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)
